// First Time Setup Lloyds Student Setup Welcome to Lloyds Student your all-in-one finance solution during Uni ! \n\nIn order to set up your Lloyds Student App we need to take a few details to link your bank account with the app and get you started 1. Online Banking User ID 2. Online Banking Password Next we need you to set-up a four digit passcode which you\'ll use each time you log into the app to keep your details secure try to make your passcode memorable but also unique and secure Passcode: Confirm: Sorry but your online login details didn\'t match our records (Make sure you\'re using your Online Banking Login) Sorry but your inputs didn\'t match. Please try again making sure you enter both passcodes the same
// Budget Activity My Weekly Budget Is\u00A0 You\'ve spent less than last week You\'ve got\u00A0\u00A0 \u00A0 left this week Add Cash Entry Budget Settings
// Chart Titles Where You\'re Spending Weekly Spend Weekly Overview Welcome to Lloyds Student. \n\nPlease enter your 4 digit pass code to Login and View your account
// Cash Entry Cash Purchase Use this dialouge to log any cash purchases you\'ve made so your budgeting advice can be as accurate as possible ! If you don\'t log your cash purchases then the ATM transactions will just show up in the Misc category of your budgeting Purchase Name Category Amount Balance Cancel Add Choose a country

Enter the account details of the person you want to pay (Limit: Minimum £1, Maximum daily: £300) Home Banking should always be as safe as possible. We use the latest online security measures to protect your money, your personal information and your privacy. We guarantee to refund your money in the unlikely event you experience fraud with our Internet Banking service - as long as you\'ve been careful, for example, by taking reasonable steps to keep your security information safe. We protect you with safeguards that meet Industry Standards. Lloyds Bank plc is authorised by the Prudential Regulation Authority and regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority and the Prudential Regulation Authority under registration number 119278. Authorisation can be checked on the Financial Services Register at www.fca.org.uk. Lloyds Bank plc are members of the Financial Services Compensation Scheme and the Financial Ombudsman Service. We subscribe to the Lending Code; copies of the Code can be obtained from www.lendingstandardsboard.org.uk. Log Out Are you sure you want to Quit ? Yes No If you have any query regarding your online banking or report a card lost or stolen then you can use one of the below options. Email Call Us Live Chat Call the helpline Your call may be recorded for training or monitoring purposes. Call charges applies, Please check with your local provider for more information. Cancel Call Email This will take you into an email app. We will respond back to you within 2 working days. Cancel Email We greatly value your feedback to help us maintain our current features. You could make a real difference to our service and it would really help us understand what we have to do in order to give a better service to our customer\'s. Submit Welcome to your Lloyds Banking Tour We will go though each aspect of the Lloyds Mobile Banking Application. \nSwipe to find out more. You can switch between tabs easily with a touch of a button. There are three buttons at the top of the screen which will take you to different aspect of the Lloyds Banking App. You are ready to try the app for yourself. Feel free to come again and go through these tour to familiarise your self with what Lloyds Banking Group offers. Swipe to the right of the screen to access the Help Menu. Here you will find all the necessary settings and functions which are associated with Lloyds Banking Group. Manage and access your money instantly. With the help of Lloyds Banking App, you get to view your account balance, transactions and also get to switch between other accounts. Fraud Detection feature in place to keep your money safe. If you don\'t recognise a transaction on your Account Overview, you can report it straightaway to our Fraud Team with a touch of a button. Now it\'s been made easier for you to transfer money to a payee with using our Lloyds Banking App. Transactions are carried out instantly and within minutes it will appear on your Account Overview. Update your details Change Passcode Change Account name Change Background NetworkErrorActivity Lost/Stole Having an issue Update your Personal Details Customer\'s are advice to change their personal details using our Lloyd\'s App. Edit you details below and submit your request by clicking on the Update button. Please allow 48 hours for changes to take effect. Terms and Condition 1.1 This document sets out the general conditions for our sterling bank accounts and related banking services for personal customers resident in the United Kingdom (‘UK’). These accounts and services may also have additional conditions (see condition 2 for more details). If we offer other services in the future, we will make it clear at the time if these general conditions will apply to them. Once you have registered, we can also provide Mobile Banking. This includes a range of text alert services where we send you text messages with information about your current accounts and Mobile Banking which allows you to access information on your accounts and give us certain instructions using your mobile phone. 1.2 You may not be eligible for all of our accounts or services or all the features they have – for example, we will not give you a Planned Overdraft if you are under 18. We may also limit the number of accounts or services you can hold with us. 1.3 An important part of our role as your bank is to provide you with services to help you manage your finances. We do not generally provide advice, but we can use information we have about you to suggest other services we think might interest you. To find out more about how we and other Lloyds Banking Group companies use your personal information, please read the section at the end of these terms and conditions headed ‘Important information about your personal information’. Please ask us if you have any questions about this agreement or any other matter by visiting one of our branches, calling us or writing to us. 2.1 This agreement for the above bank accounts and related banking services is made up of the ‘general conditions’ in this document and any ‘additional conditions’ we give you for these accounts or services. We will tell you if these general conditions apply when you take a new product or service from us. 2.2 If any additional condition conflicts with any general condition in this document, the additional condition will apply. For example a savings account may have different terms for working out or paying interest, so those terms will apply instead of the conflicting terms in these general conditions. 3.1 Our contact details are in the contact details section at the beginning of this document. 3.2 You can contact us and give us instructions in branch, through Telephone Banking, Internet Banking or Mobile Banking (once you have registered for them), or by using a card. Any instructions you give us are not effective until we actually receive them. You can usually use our Telephone, Internet and Mobile Banking services and Cashpoint machines at all times but occasionally repairs, updates and routine maintenance on our systems and those of our suppliers may mean that a particular service cannot be used for a short time (usually just minutes). 3.3 We may contact you by post, telephone and electronically using the contact details you give us (including any electronic address that we agree with you will be used to send you electronic communications). When we use the words ‘electronic’ or ‘electronically’ in this agreement we mean any form of message made by any type of telecommunication, digital or IT device (including the internet, digital television, email and text message). You must tell us if your name or contact details change. If you do not tell us, we will go on using the details you last gave us, and we will not be responsible if we fail to contact you or if we send confidential information to the wrong address using out of date details. We will charge you our reasonable costs of finding you (or trying to find you) if your contact details are not up to date. 3.4 We may listen into or record any phone calls with you to check we have carried out your instructions correctly, to help improve our service, check that we comply with our regulatory obligations, and to help detect or prevent fraud or other crimes. 4.1 When we contact you or you contact us we need to check your identity before you can give us instructions or we can disclose or discuss confidential information about your accounts. For this reason: a. you must sign instructions given on paper; b. when you are in a branch, we may ask you for identification; and c. if you are contacting us or giving us instructions by any other method (for example by using a card, Telephone Banking, Internet Banking or by Mobile Banking) you must do so using the ‘Security Details’ we have given to you or agreed with you personally. 5.1 General conditions about payments into your account. a. In this condition we explain the timing of different types of payment into your account. b. On some of our current accounts we offer instant cheque value, which means we will start paying you any interest straight away for the first £1,000 of cheques you pay in over the counter at one of our branches before the cut-off time on a working day. For amounts over £1,000 or where we do not offer instant cheque value. c. if you are contacting us or giving us instructions by any other method (for example by using a card, Telephone Banking, Internet Banking or by Mobile Banking) you must do so using the ‘Security Details’ we have given to you or agreed with you personally. 6.1 If two or more of you are party to this agreement, the following terms apply: a. Any of you can give us instructions independently of the others on your joint accounts. This means any one of you can, for example, withdraw all or any money on an account without the knowledge of the others, close an account or end a service, ask for statements and correspondence to be given electronically alone or by paper too, and apply for overdrafts, cards and other services or different accounts with benefits packages which are covered by this agreement, and which are available on your joint accounts. We will not normally make enquiries about the purpose of any payment instruction or other instruction or confirm the instructions with the other joint customers. b. Any one of you can replace an account or service with another account or service covered by these general conditions on behalf of all of you. c. We may give any information about your joint account and the payments on it to any one of you, although you can ask us to send you separate current account statements if you live at different addresses. We can act on information about you which any of you gives us. c. If any of you die, we can, but are not bound to, continue to act on the instructions of the remaining joint customers in relation to any joint accounts held by you, including allowing them to withdraw any or all money from the accounts and provide instructions relating to any services or benefits associated with the accounts. Lloyds Bank plc. Registered Office:\n 25 Gresham Street, London EC2V 7HN.\n Registered in England and Wales no. 2065.\n Lloyds Bank plc is authorised by the Prudential\n Regulation Authority and regulated by the\n Financial Conduct Authority and the Prudential\n Regulation Authority under registration\n number 119278.\n \nInformation correct as at April 2014.
Welcome to our help centre. Here you can find answers to out Frequently Asked Questions. If for any reason you couldn\'t find what you are looking for, then please do try and get in touch with us either via phone or email. How can I contact my local branch? To contact us by phone, please call us on 0845 3 000 000 (calls may be recorded). Our UK-based advisers are able to answer a wide range of banking queries and are available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. They are able to put you in touch with your local branch if required. I don\'t recognise a transaction on my account - what do I do? You can use our Fraud Detection feature we have introduced new to our app. Next to every transaction there is a question mark symbol next to it, if you believe that that transaction is not been made by you then click on the symbol and follow the wizard on the screen. Who can I contact if I have a query on my balance and transaction? If you want to talk to us about your balance or transactions, call Phonebank on 0845 3 000 000 or go to any Lloyds Bank branch. How do I transfer money to another person? If you\'re registered for Mobile Banking, you can transfer money between accounts and also make payments to pay a bill or another person through your phone, please do have a look on our Lloyds Banking Tour to familiarise your self with how to go about it. Can I change my Passcode? Yes you can, click on the Account Management option inside the Help Menu. This will take you to another window where you will have the option to change your Passcode. Report Online Lost or stolen cards If your Lloyds Bank credit or debit card has been lost or stolen you should report it immediately. You can report it through this app or by calling us.\n \nIf your Visa Debit Card is lost or stolen, we’ll cancel your old card and deliver a new one to you usually within 3-5 working days. If your card is declined, there are transactions that you don’t recognise or you need a new PIN, call us by clicking on the button below. We guarantee to refund your money in the unlikely event you experience fraud with our Internet Banking service – as long as you’ve been careful, for example, by taking reasonable steps to keep your security information safe. We will trace your report and get in touch with you to inform the outcome. One of our member from the Fraud Department will be in touch with you and this usually happens within the 12 hour period that you have reported to us. Lloyds Bank plc is authorised by the Prudential Regulation Authority and regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority and the Prudential Regulation Authority under registration number 119278. Authorisation can be checked on the Financial Services Register at www.fca.org.uk. Lloyds Bank plc is a member of the Financial Services Compensation Scheme and the Financial Ombudsman Service. We subscribe to the Lending Code; copies of the Code can be obtained from www.lendingstandardsboard.org.uk.\n \nLloyds Bank plc Registered Office: 25 Gresham Street, London EC2V 7HN. Registered in England and Wales No. 2065. Be wary of suspicious calls, we\'ll never ask you to transfer money out of your account to another account for security purposes. There are simple solutions you can put in place to keep you and your information safe online. Find out how you can: Use anti-virus software Prevent spam Secure your wireless connection Keep your operating system up to date Make fast, easy transfers between Lloyds Bank accounts and easily access your credit card, current account and savings account statements online or either by paper statement. Switch to paperless and receive your credit card, current account and savings statements safely and easily online. Why get your statements online? You can safely access your account statements online. Easily search your account statements by date, amount or payment type. Having an issue It is important to us to make sure that our customer\'s are getting a good service and that they are staying safe while using Mobile Banking with Lloyds Banking Group. f you been experiencing any sort of difficulties while using Lloyds mobile banking app please use this section of the app to get in touch with us. \n \nOne of our staff from the Customer Service will be in touch with you to resolve your issue, this doesn\'t take any more than 12 hour from when you have completed our online process.

We\’ll give you all the information you need to find your way around each section with images, tips and advices. Whether you\'re buying your first home, looking for a better deal or simply want to know more about mortgages, we can help.\n \nOur mortgage basics guide covers what you will need to think about when looking for a home and applying for a mortgage;\n
\n - Mortgage promise\n - Moving costs\n - Property types\n - Valuation schemes\n - Repayment methods\n - Mortgage products\n - Legal work Find out more about Mortgages Find out more about Credit Cards Managed properly, a credit card can be a safe and convenient way to pay for things – from a weekly shop to a summer holiday.\n \nBefore you apply\n \n - Check that you’re registered to vote \n - Make sure other accounts have your current address details \n - Have important personal details to hand
Find out more about Loans Used wisely, loans are a powerful financial tool that can help you get what you want out of life.\n \nOne of the best ways of comparing different loans of different interest rates and lengths is to look at the total amount repayable. This tells you, over the entire life of the loan, how much you will have to repay in total.\n \nIn summary, make sure you know the repayment terms of your loan before signing up and make sure you\’ll have enough income to make the repayments on time and without any worries. Find out more about Insurance Get useful tips and help with understanding your insurance and protecting the things you care about.\n \n - Winter-proof your home\n - Protect your home against burglars\n - Find out what wear and tear means\n - Protect your home against floods BudgetSettings We guarantee to refund your money in the unlikely event you experience fraud with our Internet Banking service - as long as you’ve been careful, for example, by taking reasonable steps to keep your security information safe. Keep your password secure and do not let anyone else make use of your security details Do not let anyone watch you enter your security details After each session make sure to log out off the system With Lloyds Bank you have the confidence that shopping on the Internet is as safe and easy as shopping on the high street. That\'s because we promise you that whenever you use your Lloyds Bank credit or debit card to shop online, you\'ll be protected against fraud
Whenever you buy goods or services online with participating retailers, Lloyds Bank ClickSafe® will give you extra protection against card crime.
